channel.title: Possible glitch
channel.description:
I just read this bug on the RS forums. I guy was dueling when he lost his internet connection. When he logged back in he had 38/50 hp, but his hp wouldnt go up. The good part is it also wouldnt go [i]down[/i].
I suggest some one trys it, could be a nice little glitch. Pretty sure its been reported, might not be fixed.

item.title: Possible glitch
item.dc:creator: @ThatGuyWhoDoesStuff ThatGuyWhoDoesStuff
item.description:
@ThatGuyWhoDoesStuff wrote:

Thats true, should have thought of that.

Thought it just may have been another of the many bugs going around.

Read full topic

item.title: Possible glitch
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

no, becasue it wont read it like that, the server know whos hitting who, so when this guy gets hit, he knows his offical hp, and the hp he has, plus the ho he just lost, then it sends the client his new hp stats, so if he lost his internet connection, it would accutally keep fighting(happend to me several times) until ethier one dies. since its the server running him, and the client sends nothing else(like a log out) and hes fighting, he will fight that person until its over

Read full topic

item.title: Possible glitch
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

jme_009:

Your health is dealt by the server, not your computer, so I highly doubt this is true. It’s unfortunate, but the internet is full of liers and bullshitters.

You don’t get it, if the server is reading a dual and lets say the guy get’s hit “13” and right at that moment his internet connection gives way, the server will think it as a minus whatever hp he had so it’ll stay that way. I don’t believe the “wont go down” part though.

Read full topic
